title: Scoreboard General
custom_preconds:
**All cases should be run on both Handset and Tablet unless specifically noted.**
Cases for Handset only are indicated with **[H]**
Cases for Tablet only are indicated with **[T]**

Scoreboard Data File - Comes from this file adjusted for each year and date - 
https://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/schedule?hydrate=decisions,probablePitcher,broadcasts(all),game(content(highlights(live),limit=5,media(epg)),tickets),linescore(matchup,runners,positions),stats,person,team,flags,liveLookin,gameId,venue(location)&sportId=1,51&date=07/07/2018

Game Type - Code defining which season or round game belongs to. (Exhibition [E], Spring Training [S], Regular Season [R], Postseason [D, C, W] etc.) 
Game State/Game Status - Code defining whether a game is scheduled, in progress, or completed with varying in between states. 
Refresh Rate - App setting, dictates how often the scoreboard polls the Scoreboard Data File to refresh the Scoreboard data.

title: Scoreboard Navigation
custom_preconds:
Sections and cases for Handset only are indicated with **[H]**

Date Range - server side file that sets the allowed date range within which the user can navigate on the scoreboard. (Differs for each release version of the app but can be found here: https://atbatappconfig.mlb.com/android/7.0.0/ranges.json

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the forward arrow once [H]
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scoreboard should move forward by one day

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the back arrow once [H]
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scoreboard should move backward by one day

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps and holds the forward arrow [H]
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Scoreboard should move forward one day at a time and after a few seconds the speed of the forward navigation should increase until the user lets go of the arrow. 
Then the user should be left on the date they expect to be left on.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps and holds the back arrow [H]
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Scoreboard should move backward one day at a time and after a few seconds the speed of the backward navigation should increase until the user lets go of the arrow. 
Then the user should be left on the date they expect to be left on.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the date at the top of the Scoreboard page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Calendar Date Picker dialog should appear showing the current month
and arrows to the left and right of the month
and today's date highlighted
and each date will have the number of games scheduled for that day
and there will be two options underneath the calendar: "Cancel" "Go To Today"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to a date by tapping it from the calendar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Calendar Date Picker should close and the scoreboard should load the date the user selected.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has navigated to another date
And the user launches the Calendar Date Picker
And the user taps the 'Today' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to today's date
And the games on the scoreboard for today's date should load.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to select a date outside the date range using the date picker.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should not able to select a date from the date picker outside of the allowed date range.
And the user should be taken to the First or Last date allowed in the date range.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to use the back arrow from the first date available in the date range [H]
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the back arrow should not appear on the first date in the date range.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to use the forward arrow from the last date available in the date range [H]
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the forward arrow should not appear on the last date in the date range.

custom_steps_separated.expected:

And the game cell should show the game status as "Postponed"

custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Gameday Webview for that game
And the Postponement status and reason for the postponement should appear

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify a game that has been Suspended
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the text "Susp" should appear with the inning status
ex: "Susp/4"

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify a game that has been Suspended, and that has the resume date available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the inning status should appear 
and the text "Suspended: Resumes [date]" should be displayed at the top of the game cell

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify the Resume date for a suspended game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the scheduled resumption time should appear
and the text "Resumed from (date)" should appear at the top of the game cell
and the Score should be shown on the scoreboard
and the Inning status should NOT appear on the scoreboard

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify a game that has been forfeited
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The inning status should NOT appear on the Scoreboard
and the game status should show the word "Forfeit"

title: No-Hitter/Perfect Game indicator
custom_preconds:
UI/UX Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=55312418

Screen: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/ANDROID-4244

A perfect game is a game in which a pitcher (or combination of pitchers) pitches a victory that lasts a minimum of nine innings in which no opposing player reaches base.  A no-hitter is a game in which a team was not able to record a single hit.

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in progress after the 6th inning, if no batter has reached the base.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a Perfect Game indicator at the top of the game cell

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in a suspended state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a Perfect Game indicator at the top of the game cell

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in extra innings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a Perfect Game indicator at the top of the game cell

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is final
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a Perfect Game indicator at the top of the game cell

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is a Perfect Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then that game cell should continue to follow standard sorting rules (see General Scoreboard for more details, but should respect Favorite Team order and active over final)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress
and the flag on master_scoreboard changes from 
(is_perfect_game="Y" and is_no_hitter="N") to 
(is_perfect_game="N" and is_no_hitter="Y")
and the user is on Scoreboard

e.g. Pitcher loses perfect game but is now pitching a no-hitter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator changes to a No-Hitter indicator on the Scoreboard at the top of the game cell when the Scoreboard refreshes

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress
and the flag on master_scoreboard changes from 
(is_perfect_game="Y" and is_no_hitter="N") to 
(is_perfect_game="N" and is_no_hitter="N")
and the user is on Scoreboard

e.g. Pitcher loses perfect game and no-hitter simultaneously
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator is removed from the Scoreboard when the Scoreboard refreshes, user will NOT see the indicator downgraded to No-Hitter

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress
and the flag on master_scoreboard changes from 
(is_perfect_game="N" and is_no_hitter="Y") to 
(is_perfect_game="N" and is_no_hitter="N")
and the user is on Scoreboard

e.g. Pitcher loses no-hitter
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the No-Hitter indicator is removed from the Scoreboard when the Scoreboard refreshes

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Perfect Game or No-hitter indicator
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then nothing will happen and the indicator is for informational/visual purposes only

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the device is set to Spanish
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a Perfect Game (or No-Hitter)
and the indicator is on the Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the text in the indicator text will display in Spanish

No-Hitter - Sin hit
Perfect Game - Juego perfecto
